s.text: **A cold winter might conceivably help Bill Bradley win the nomination, but as a Democrat in the general election he'd have to contend with accusations that his party caused the recession.
On the other hand, if the temperature stayed warm, there would be no oil price spike, hence probably no recession.
On the other hand, if the temperature stayed warm, there would be no oil price spike, hence probably no recession.

On the other hand, if the temperature stayed warm, there would be no oil price spike, hence probably no recession.
An added benefit of a warm winter, of course, would be that it would make it clearer than ever that Gore's concern about global warming is well-founded.
On the other hand, if the temperature stayed warm, there would be no oil price spike, hence probably no recession.

On the other hand, if the temperature stayed warm, there would be no oil price spike, hence probably no recession.
This is the sense in which Gore is an ironic beneficiary of global warming , the ongoing natural catastrophe that Gore's been issuing jeremiads about for several years.
* His chances of winning the general election--and maybe the nomination**--would be greatly diminished.
* His chances of winning the general election--and maybe the nomination**--would be greatly diminished.
An added benefit of a warm winter, of course, would be that it would make it clearer than ever that Gore's concern about global warming is well-founded.
